intro: Ardisia stichantha, commonly known as the red-berried ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its berries, which are bright red when mature, are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia stichantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
